metadata.title: CVE-2019-0155 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Insufficient access control in a subsystem for Intel (R) processor graphicsin 6th, 7th, 8th and 9th Generation Intel(R) Core(TM) Processor Families;Intel(R) Pentium(R) Processor J, N, Silver and Gold Series; Intel(R)Celeron(R) Processor J, N, G3900 and G4900 Series; Intel(R) Atom(R)Processor A and E3900 Series; Intel(R) Xeon(R) Processor E3-1500 v5 and v6,E-2100 and E-2200 Processor Families; Intel(R) Graphics Driver for Windowsbefore 26.20.100.6813 (DCH) or 26.20.100.6812 and before 21.20.x.5077(aka15.45.5077), i915 Linux Driver for Intel(R) Processor Graphics beforeversions 5.4-rc7, 5.3.11, 4.19.84, 4.14.154, 4.9.201, 4.4.201 may allow anauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via localaccess.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-169-generic - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-169-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-169-lowlatency - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-169-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-169-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-169-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-169-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-169-generic - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-169-lowlatency - 4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1059-aws - 4.4.0-1059.63
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1064-azure - 4.15.0-1064.69~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-169.198~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1059.63').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69~14.04.1').
